The claim is supported by a graphic show: s State of the Union address, which stated that "92 percent of Americans support background checks for gun buyers." This graphic was displayed on the official White House website.
The claim is backed by an independent po: which found that 92 percent of registered voters support background checks for all gun buyers. This poll was described as "overwhelming" by the Quinnipiac pollsters.
Another poll conducted by Pew Research C: including 85 percent of gun owners) favor making private gun sales and sales at gun shows subject to background checks.
A CBS: New York Times poll also showed that 92 percent of Americans (including 85 percent of respondents living in a household with an NRA member) support universal background checks.
